programme.title: Sporta momenti
programme.desc: Dokumentālās sērijas aplūko aizraujošos stāstus, ko atklāj slavenākās fotogrāfijas sporta vēsturē. Iemūžinātie mirkļi ataino spilgtākos divdesmitā gadsimta atlētus, kā arī ilustrē svarīgus momentus, kas mainījuši sporta vēstures gaitu.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses Is eight-year-old son Seti becomes king and all eyes are on him; the young prince representes the future of the new royal family which has yet to assert its influence over the kingdom.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Allied leaders meet for their first conference to discuss the coordination of their efforts, a Japanese Division is destroyed at sea, and the Red Army begins its advance towards Berlin.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Vatican Secret Files Exposed: The Pope and the Devil
programme.sub-title: Hitler unleashed war and Pius XII organised meetings to thwart him, but the Allies did not trust the Popes words; meanwhile, Hitler had started sending Jews to their deaths in concentration camps.
programme.desc: New and previously published documents identified and analysed by a team of experts show that the plans of Pius XII and and his closest collaborators saved over 700,000 Jews during World War II.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses Is eight-year-old son Seti becomes king and all eyes are on him; the young prince representes the future of the new royal family which has yet to assert its influence over the kingdom.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Nestled in the Jordanian desert, Petra is regarded as the eighth wonder of the world; scientists are still fascinated by its facades carved into the rock, its temples, and its unique hydraulic system.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: David Muise teams with Adam for a new adventure in the search for Slumachs lost gold mine.
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: We discover an intriguing new theory about Gobekli Tepe in southern Turkey; one of the worlds oldest mysteries dating back over 12,000 years, we still dont understand who built it or why.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The House of Romanov had imposed 300 years of strict Imperial rule, but royal authority was in question for the first time. The future of the Romanov dynasty was in danger.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Myths: Great Mysteries of Humanity
programme.sub-title: El Dorado is the city of gold; evidence of it can be found all over South America from Peru to Guyana and Colombia, but only one of these leads traces back to the origins of the legend.
programme.desc: Myths: how much truth lies behind them? This series takes a look at some of the speculations surrounding myths, explores outlandish theories, and puts the science behind these myths to the test.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender
programme.sub-title: January 28th, 1945: the war reaches its climax on German soil. It is the beginning of a hundred days of horror and death, claiming more lives than in all the years of war.
programme.desc: These are the last hundred days of World War ll; we recount crucial milestones in the last days of the Third Reich and its steady decline towards the inevitable capitulation.

programme.title: Abu Simbel: Giants of the Nile
programme.desc: Ramses II launched the construction of two temples dedicated to the Pharaoh and to his wife Nefertari; how did the Egyptians organise and manage such a project 1,500 kilometres from the Nile delta?

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Seti I is still in his prime when he dies in 1279 B.C. / B.C.E.; despite his short reign, it proves brilliant and gives Prince Ramses ample time to perfect his education for his future role as king.

programme.sub-title: The Germans continue their retreat from Russia, but the most significant event at this stage of the war is the second front in Europe with the D-Day landings on June 6th - Operation Overlord.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: The True Story of the Tattooist of Auschwitz
programme.desc: Lali and Gita Sokolovs story stands as a powerful tribute to human endurance; this documentary sheds light on their incredible love story while revisiting the horrors of Auschwitz and the Holocaust.

programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Seti I is still in his prime when he dies in 1279 B.C. / B.C.E.; despite his short reign, it proves brilliant and gives Prince Ramses ample time to perfect his education for his future role as king.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Greatest Events of World War II In Colour
programme.sub-title: When Japans expansion in the Pacific reaches fever pitch, Roosevelt must act. Instead of having them back down by cutting off oil supplies, he pushes them to attack the US fleet in Pearl Harbor.
programme.desc: A story of World War II told through the ten most pivotal moments in the conflict, supported by exquisitely restored and colourised footage. This is World War II as youve never seen it before.

programme.title: Vatican Secret Files Exposed: The Pope and the Devil
programme.sub-title: Hitler once said that the Pope was his personal enemy; he could finally carry out his revenge on Pius XII after the Nazi occupation of Italy, so he decided to invade the Vatican and kidnap the Pope.
programme.desc: New and previously published documents identified and analysed by a team of experts show that the plans of Pius XII and and his closest collaborators saved over 700,000 Jews during World War II.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Germans continue their retreat from Russia, but the most significant event at this stage of the war is the second front in Europe with the D-Day landings on June 6th - Operation Overlord.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Nestled in the Jordanian desert, Petra is regarded as the eighth wonder of the world; scientists are still fascinated by its facades carved into the rock, its temples, and its unique hydraulic system.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Myths: Great Mysteries of Humanity
programme.sub-title: Countless stories have circulated about Cleopatra for over 2000 years; which ones are true, and will the latest archaeological discoveries give insight into the real life story of Egypts final queen?
programme.desc: Myths: how much truth lies behind them? This series takes a look at some of the speculations surrounding myths, explores outlandish theories, and puts the science behind these myths to the test.

programme.title: The True Story of the Tattooist of Auschwitz
programme.desc: Lali and Gita Sokolovs story stands as a powerful tribute to human endurance; this documentary sheds light on their incredible love story while revisiting the horrors of Auschwitz and the Holocaust.

programme.title: A Justice of Terror
programme.desc: We reveal how laws were used by the Nazis to justify the unjustifiable and authorise the most heinous of crimes, and we also learn what role jurists played in this reinterpretation of law.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses the Great has earned the distinction of being the most feared and respected pharaoh when he signs the first true peace treaty in human history with longstanding foes the Hittites.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: D-Day: The Soldiers Story
programme.sub-title: Giles Milton visits key D-Day sites along the Normandy coastline - including Omaha Beach and Pegasus Bridge - and we hear the stories of the men and women on both the attacking and defensive lines.
programme.desc: A two-part documentary that tells the story of D-Day - June the 6th, 1944 like its never been told before as presenter Giles Milton reveals an astonishing tale of fear, courage and heroism.

programme.title: Vatican Secret Files Exposed: The Pope and the Devil
programme.sub-title: With the war over, thousands of Nazis were fleeing Europe with the help of members of the Vatican, but there was another man who declared himself an enemy of the Pope: Joseph Stalin.
programme.desc: New and previously published documents identified and analysed by a team of experts show that the plans of Pius XII and and his closest collaborators saved over 700,000 Jews during World War II.

programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Who Wrote the New Testament?
programme.desc: When was the New Testament written and who wrote it? The greatest specialists in the study of the holy text are called upon to solve the mystery and to try to answer all of these questions.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: The new discovery of an old map lines up with clues in an eyewitness testimony and could point to where Slumach found his gold.
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The crucifixion of Jesus changed the world; how much of our understanding of this event is true, and what answers can be found in the Holy Land to back up the Bibles story?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.
